message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and radiographic findings suggest the patient has pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis. One drug that can cause a similar pattern of pulmonary function testing as seen in this disease is methotrexate, which is a dihydrofolate reductase inhibitor used in cancer chemotherapy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The radiographic and biopsy findings suggest the patient has a form of interstitial lung disease, specifically pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis. Among the options, only dihydrofolate reductase inhibitors (such as methotrexate) can cause a similar pattern of pulmonary function testing as this disease. Microtubule inhibitors, purine analogues, and pyrimidine analogues are not known to cause this particular pattern of lung disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Subpleural cystic enlargement and biopsy revealing fibroblast proliferation are characteristic of pulmonary fibrosis, which can be caused by certain chemotherapy drugs. Among the options, only dihydrofolate reductase inhibitors are known to cause pulmonary fibrosis as a side effect. Microtubule inhibitors, purine analogues, and pyrimidine analogues are not associated with this side effect.

Methotrexate, a dihydrofolate reductase inhibitor used in chemotherapy, can cause a similar pattern of pulmonary function testing as seen in this disease.

Among the options, only Dihydrofolate reductase inhibitors (such as methotrexate) have been reported to cause a similar pattern of pulmonary function testing as seen in this disease.
